recipe_def.notes: Bootstrap production path for mare regolith using the simple mining process.

steps.notes: Extract ilmenite from regolith; yields generated in process.

recipe_def.assumptions: Extraction yields ~0.6 kg ilmenite per 1 kg regolith input; tailings ~0.4 kg.
recipe_def.notes: In-situ ilmenite extraction from regolith; placeholder yields and mass balance.
recipe_def.name: Recipe for ilmenite extraction from regolith

steps.notes: Collection of carbonaceous chondrite regolith from meteorite impact sites. Rare (1-2% of lunar surface) but critical for carbon and volatile extraction. Slower than generic mining due to site prospecting and travel.

recipe_def.notes:
Collection process for carbonaceous regolith from CM/CI chondrite impact sites.
Targets areas with visible dark material enrichment and organic compound signatures.
Rich in carbon (2-5%), water (10%), and volatiles - essential for ISRU operations.

steps.notes: Extract carbon reductant from carbonaceous regolith feedstock.

recipe_def.assumptions: Carbonaceous regolith feedstock available for small-scale carbon recovery.
recipe_def.notes: ISRU extraction route for carbon reductant; drying and sizing steps deferred.

recipe_def.assumptions: Local production path added; replace import placeholder with real production pathway.
recipe_def.notes: Manufacturing recipe for carbon reducing agent using carbon_reductant input.

steps.notes: Single-step carbothermal reduction from ore to iron pig/ingot.

recipe_def.notes: Direct path from iron ore/ilmenite to iron_pig_or_ingot using the iron_smelting_reduction_v0 process.
recipe_def.name: Recipe for iron pig or ingot

recipe_def.assumptions: Feedstock is pig iron (iron_pig_or_ingot); steel_refining_basic_v0 outputs a billet/slab and slag.
recipe_def.notes: Casting/refining a pig iron feed into steel billet or slab. Uses basic refining/casting furnaces.
recipe_def.name: Recipe for steel billet or slab v0

recipe_def.assumptions: Pig iron to steel ingot via refining to billet/slab then casting to ingot.
recipe_def.name: Recipe for steel ingot v0

steps.notes: Heat steel ingot or billet to rolling temperature (1100-1250C)
Hot roll to plate or sheet thickness with multiple passes

recipe_def.assumptions: Steel plate/sheet production from steel ingots via hot rolling. Plate is >6mm thick, sheet is <6mm. Pickling or cold rolling can be added for improved surface finish and dimensional control. QA inspection omitted here to avoid circular dependency on finished_part.
recipe_def.notes: Steel plate and sheet stock for fabrication, structural components, and enclosures. Surface treatment not yet modeled explicitly.

recipe_def.assumptions: Sheet production path from ingot to metal_sheet_or_plate; updated to modern steps format
recipe_def.notes: Placeholder recipe: convert ingot to sheet/plate
recipe_def.name: Recipe for metal_sheet_or_plate v0

recipe_def.notes:
Simple recipe for steel welding rods.
Form steel wire/rod from steel stock, add flux coating.
Uses basic metal forming process to create wire rod form.

steps.notes: Forge rough blank from steel stock or billet.
Precision machining for tolerances and surface finish.
Optional protective coating or surface treatment; replace with heat treat if needed.

recipe_def.assumptions: Generic precision part; geometry-specific fixturing and heat treatment to be added. Uses steel stock feed.
recipe_def.notes: Coarse three-step path to a precision-machined steel part; swap final step with heat treatment/plating as required.

steps.notes: Mine mare regolith from surface
Screen and separate size fractions
Crush and grind coarse regolith to powder
Extract oxygen and produce metal byproduct via MRE

recipe_def.assumptions: Co-product metal alloy from MRE; refining not modeled.

steps.notes: Cast metal billets for beam stock
Roll to I-beam profile
Machine/cut to length

recipe_def.assumptions: ISRU route using regolith metal; 5% casting loss, 2% rolling loss, 8% machining loss
recipe_def.notes: ISRU variant using regolith_metal_crude from regolith. Enables local production of structural I-beams.

steps.notes: Hot roll regolith metal into bar or billet shapes

recipe_def.assumptions: ISRU route using regolith metal; 5% rolling loss to scale and trim
recipe_def.notes: ISRU variant using regolith_metal_crude from regolith. Enables local production of steel bar and billet stock for forging and machining.

steps.notes: Roll billet into bar stock

inputs.notes: Steel billet for rolling into bar stock

recipe_def.assumptions: Local production path; placeholder; replace with detailed BOM and routing as needed.
recipe_def.notes: Converted from import_stub to a local production path using the existing rolling process.

steps.notes: Cast large bolt and nut blanks in batches (M16-M30 sizes)
Machine threads, hex heads, and bearing surfaces on large fasteners
Heat treat large fasteners for strength and durability
Sort and kit large bolts, nuts, washers by size

recipe_def.assumptions: Non-versioned fastener kit assembled from same process steps as v0; includes large bolts, nuts, washers in M16-M30 range
recipe_def.notes: Recipe for fastener_kit_large (non-versioned) derived from v0.

steps.notes: Cut structural sections to length and prepare joints
Bend or notch sections as needed for frame geometry
Tack weld frame assembly and verify alignment
Full penetration structural welding of all joints
Machine mounting surfaces and bolt holes to tolerance
Inspect welds, check dimensional tolerances and alignment

inputs.notes: Bar stock for box section reinforcements (formed into square tubing)

recipe_def.assumptions: 500 kg heavy structural steel frame for press brake or forming equipment. Welded I-beam construction with mounting surfaces and reinforcements.
recipe_def.notes: Six-step fabrication process for heavy structural frame including cutting, forming, assembly, structural welding, finish machining, and inspection.

steps.notes: Finish grind and balance installed roll set.
Assemble frame, rolls, hydraulics, guards, and fasteners.
Integrate power electronics, sensors, and wiring harnesses.
Run loaded passes, verify roll gap adjustment and safety systems.

recipe_def.assumptions: Plate rolling mill assembled from prefabricated frame, machined components, hydraulic system, power electronics, and roll set.
recipe_def.notes: Assembly-focused route aligned to BOM mass; upstream fabrication handled by component recipes.
